item.title: To REM Perchance to Dream
item.description: “… At first Senseless as beasts I gave men sense, Possessed them of mind… In the beginning, seeing, they saw amiss, And hearing, heard not, but like phantoms huddled In dreams, the perplexed story of their days confounded…" Aeschylus, “Prometheus Bound” “Man permits himself to be deceived in his dreams every night of his life” Nietzsche “On Truth and Lies in the Extramoral sense” “A man dreamed… and when he awoke he went to his soothsayer and desired that his dream be made plain unto him.
